intro: Selinum cervicaria, commonly known as meadow garlic, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant has finely divided, feather-like leaves that are aromatic when crushed. It typically grows in moist, grassy areas and is native to Europe and parts of Asia. Selinum cervicaria is often found in meadows and along stream banks, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
